meanings.sent1: After the movie ended, they decided to try restarting it to watch from the beginning.
meanings.sent2: When the computer froze, I had to restart it to make it work again.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept restarting its attempt to catch the elusive mouse.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was restarting every time he saw her smile.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to practice restarting their math problems for better understanding.

meanings.sent1: She had to restart the puzzle after realizing she had placed the pieces incorrectly.
meanings.sent2: If you make a mistake, don't be afraid to restart and try again.

meanings.sent4: The relationship felt like it was restarting from scratch after their big fight.
meanings.sent5: Restarting the game allowed them to have a fair chance at winning.

meanings.sent4: Sometimes a good night's sleep can feel like a reboot for the mind.
meanings.sent5: Rebooting the computer can solve many performance issues.
